reviewText: The 30 minute step routine consists of 2 sections: the first one is very basic for 15 minutes and completely boring, the second one is vertical on the step and a little more varied with more impact, this one wasn't as bad. Even though the instructor is pretty friendly and cuing is not a problem, she is constantly off-beat with the awful music. I had to force myself through it and not look at the screen because she was so out of synch. I worked up a sweat because I was using 2-lb hand weights but it was just not motivating to do. The 10-minute toning section consisted of a couple of leg lifts and push ups. I think the best part was the warm-up, but it was longer and slower than I'm used to. My suggestion: don't bother with this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I first saw Kathy Kaehler in Cindy Crawford's workout, and I really liked her style, as I needed some extra cardio to help me lose weight from pregnancy, my husband and I decided to buy this step workout.I wasn't a big fan of step work outs since I always find them hard to follow but if you need something to make you sweat, burn fat and calories, without being to complicated and easy to follow, this is the DVD for you.I was able to follow it from A to Z since the very first time, as she says: it's simple, so you are able to really focus on the movement, and as my husband says, it doesn't need to be fancy in order to deliver results for you.I can really feel it it my legs, which buy the way are looking better and better each day and I sweat like C R A Z Y.This one WORKS!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I did this workout not knowing what to expect as I have read the reviews. I am an intermediate exerciser who likes to work up a sweat without the steps being too complex. I do this video on risers. It is 30 min of pure basic step so if you're into complex choreography, then you'll be bored. Some say it is repetitive, but I like doing the move enough times to know what I am doing and to benefit from it! I am not at the point where I want fancy footwork. The stretch at the begining and end were good and it was set to classical music which I thought was nice! The class seemed like a real class of exercisors. I recomend it to you if you want a good heart pumping workout without complicated moves! The negatives of this DVD is the production quality such as some blurry spots and the music is rather faint. In any case, it's still a good buy!
summary: Good heart pumping workout without complicated moves
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love step aerobics and I own many dvds and vhs workouts.  Kathy is normally a good instructer but what I really noticed in this DVD (and it made me realize that I've noticed this in past ones), was that she is often out of time to the music.  This may not upset many people, but if you are using the music to help you stay motivated and moving, it's going to trip you up a bit.  It's frustrating to see the class doing one thing and her doing another, because they've stayed in time and she's strayed a little.  At the push-up section, all the class is moving at different speeds and it's totally off-putting.  Sometimes, the music was simply way too fast for anyone to be doing step aerobics to.  It's a good workout and you will definately get a sweat going, but try to put the timing out of your head if you can.The other thing that I found to be a little annoying, was that the routines weren't structured.  Most instructors give you little routines and then build those up to one big routine.  Kathy in this DVD however, is all hickilty pickitly.  It's almost like she's making up the routine as she's going along.  There was hardly any building of a good flowing pattern.  Nothing flowed well and this makes this workout seem a little unmotivating because of the sudden and bizare changes.  She will cue you in well, (she is a good instructor), but it's not an exciting workout.  Go for Kari Anderson or Christie Taylor.  They are two of the best instructors out there.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I heard that she was a good instructor so i got this and the total fitness workout. the total fitness workout was great, but this was disappointing. the cueing wasnt great and she didnt tell which leg she was starting with. some of the partipants were either moving too fast and the music didnt really go with the workout.
summary: cueing not that great and the participants were abit off putting
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this dvd back in 2005 and I have to admit, out of all the workouts in my collection, this one is among the few that I have come back to again and again over the years.  It's true that the moves are basic but Kathy's direction are very clear and she gives tips throughout.The biggest appeal to me is that this DVD works well not only for "recycled beginners" like myself but for:*someone that's fairly new to working out,*just that's decided to get off the couch,*even if you're a more seasoned fitness fan getting over an illness, injury, or a case of the "blahs"It's just the thing to help you ease back into your workout routine and one can increase the intensity if they're creative.Another important thing is that in the beginning of the workout Kathy says you can do this workout without a step which is great for those on tight budgets or just trying to work their way up to using a step.After I got used to doing her routine on the floor, I used an old foam mat about the size of a step to get use to more focused movements then when my budget allowed, I bought a step.I started by using the top platform only and then worked my way up.Most important to me is that I consider this DVD to be "knee friendly".  I know this because I have to be mindful of some movements due to my past knee issues. This workout is "do-able and I learned how to modify moves as needed.  The DVD is also chaperted so you have even more control over how you want to approach this workout.It is because of this and all the reasons listed above that I am buying yet another copy for my job since we're currently looking into setting up a Fitness room and this would be perfect for our future workout library.  This is a workout that's accessible to many and all could benifit from it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Kathy Kaehler takes you from Ballet and Pilates to Aerobics and then completes the workout with a relaxing stretching routine. Her unique and somewhat elegant approach at the start allows you to relax, therefore causing less stress during the step segment, where you can use a step, or simply follow along without one.You can still workout comfortably and enjoy the exercises, perhaps even adding in some of your own moves or adding in walking here and there, where the exercises become less effective without the proper equipment.Throughout this vigorous routine, you will stretch, breathe deeply during the stretching routines and find yourself rather relaxed within 50 minutes. There are no weights needed, but a step is definitely recommended. A short routine on the floor and ballet stretches at the start make this an elegant and relaxing workout. The music is especially good as it moves from calming to energizing and then you return to total relaxation. I will definitely be looking for more Kathy Kaehler workouts!~The Rebecca Review
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really enjoy this DVD.  It's true, though, as many others have stated that she does not go to the beat of the music.  For me, however, during those moments, I just close my eyes and go at the "right" pace!  Other than that it is a great workout that combines stretching, yoga, intensity and cool downs.  I usually combine this workout with my other yoga DVD and it's a great workout that I actually look forward to.  The only thing I would suggest is make sure you have a "step" that's actually wide enough to do all the moves (about 4 feet wide!).
Title: N/A

reviewText: It took me a few times through this workout to totally appreciate both it and Kathy Kaehler.  I checked this DVD out of the library and the first time I played it I couldn't stand Kathy's style or the workout.  The next day I returned the DVD to the library.  Because of the limited step aerobic offerings at the library I ended up checking it out again a few weeks later and something clicked.  Now I'm a major fan of Kathy's and I love this workout (although the ballet mini-warmup may never win me over).  It was this video that coached me through a breakthrough with step aerobic lunges.  I had the hardest time mastering them until this workout.  Kathy takes them a little slower and I finally developed a technique that has vastly benefited me, my heart and my thighs.  For that alone I will forever be in Kathy's debt. I bought my own copy and now wish that Kathy had more workouts available.
Title: N/A
